message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the construction of repairable fountain codes for distributed storage systems that are information-theoretically secure against an eavesdropper. This involves the use of coding theory and cryptography, which are both relevant to the sub-categories of information theory (cs.IT) and cryptography (cs.CR). The paper also deals with distributed storage systems, which falls under the sub-category of distributed systems (cs.DS). Additionally, the paper compares the proposed codes with other types of secure codes, which could fall under the sub-categories of coding theory (cs.CC) and security and privacy (cs.SI).
